meanings.definition: Planting (something) in the wrong place or manner.
meanings.sent1: She misplanted the flowers in the shade instead of the sun.
meanings.sent2: The gardener realized he was misplanting the seeds too close together.
meanings.sent3: The misplanting of the tree made the garden look like a puzzle gone wrong.
meanings.sent4: Her misplanting of the vegetables turned the garden into a chaotic mess.
meanings.sent5: Misplanting can lead to stunted growth and unhealthy plants.

meanings.definition: The act of incorrectly placing or setting a plant in the ground.
meanings.sent1: The misplanting of the rose bush caused it to wither.
meanings.sent2: A common mistake in gardening is misplanting due to lack of knowledge.
meanings.sent3: The misplanting of the tulips made the garden look like a jumbled painting.
meanings.sent4: His misplanting of the shrubs created a disorganized landscape.
meanings.sent5: Proper guidance can prevent misplanting and ensure healthy growth of plants.
